title: Rabbit with Tomatoes
introduction: In the Ciociara region outside Rome, rabbit is a delicacy braised in a rich tomato sauce and infused with white wine, giving it a uniquely savory flavor.
ingredients: 1 rabbit (2 1/2 to 3 pounds), cut into 8 pieces
2 ounces pancetta, thickly sliced and chopped
Salt and freshly ground black pepper
2 cups peeled, seeded, and chopped plum tomatoes
instructions: Rinse the rabbit pieces, then pat dry with paper towels. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Place the rabbit in the pan, then add the pancetta, parsley, and garlic. Cook until the rabbit is nicely browned on all sides, about 15 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Remove the garlic from the pan and discard it. Stir in the wine and simmer 1 minute.
Reduce the heat to low. Stir in the tomatoes, then cook until the rabbit is tender and coming away from the bone, about 30 minutes.
Transfer the rabbit to a serving platter and serve hot with the sauce.
